content:
@Weihang Lo it seems I now got the right version - I earlier got a version that had 306315 bytes and now I got the version that isn't corrupted at 306627 Bytes which also sets the correct timestamp

-rw-rw-r-- 1 foobar foobar 306627 Dec 5 2018 hdrsample-6.0.4.tar.gz
-rw-rw-r-- 1 foobar foobar 306315 Dec 25 21:51 hdrsample-corrupted.tar.gz

I downloaded the crate straight from crates.io:
wget -O hdrsample-6.0.4.tar.gz https://crates.io/api/v1/crates/hdrsample/6.0.4/download
Oh wait - it is cargo download that is broken - for some reason it corrupts some downloads whilst wget gets the correct bytes. I will have to investigate that. Apologies for my confusion.
Does it work fine too when downloading using curl instead of wget? Cargo uses libcurl internally.
wget works fine.. cargo download uses reqwest but I think the error is how it uses reqwest so have to investigate.
pinkforest(she/her) has marked this topic as resolved.
pinkforest(she/her) has marked this topic as unresolved.
